comment.author: 28305556@N06
comment._content: Cruzair 1926 = 2pChwM; 200hp Wright J-4; span: 36'0" length: 23'10" load: 910# v: 138/117/45 range: 550; ff: 7/12/26 (p: Franklin Young). William Waterhouse. POP: 1 [2138=1724], built with assistance from Ryan Mechanics Monoplane Co; also seen spelled Cruizair. Partial plans reportedly were sold to T Claude Ryan as a project for the Mahoney-Ryan Flight School and were responsible for the Ryan M-1 Brougham design. [2138] bought from Pacific Air Transport by motion picture stunt pilot Dick Grace and extensively modified for his abortive Hawaii-San Francisco transpacific attempt on 7/4/27. Shipped back to California and rebuilt as Ryan Mechanics Co Miss Southern California for competitions
